page.title: 13CHALCROFT FARM
page.content: Chalcroft Farm is over 400 years old and covers 250 acres of land.It has 20 fields and buildings.One field is where Oliver Cromwell used to hang people.Another used to have a church in it.The buildings include an old house and barn, made out of ships timbers.There are 2 wells and a pond which were used until 1954.Electricity was introduced in 1952. Two types of cattle are kept.When the beef cattle are 18 months old they are sent to market.The milk from the dairy cattle is the main income.Soft fruit growing and the pork industry were given up as they didn't make any profit. Two of the brothers are in the milking business and the other does meat.The farm has belonged to the family since 1605.Only one job is done all year round,that is milking.Busiest months are May/August.
